Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a plant with access to water and light, accurately depicting it as healthy and growing, with green leaves and perhaps some flowers.
The student can draw a plant without water, showing it as unhealthy with wilted or brown leaves.
The student can illustrate the idea that plants need water to survive using simple symbols or notes, such as drawing a water droplet or writing 'needs water.'
The student can illustrate the idea that plants need light to survive by including a sun symbol and associating it with healthy plant growth.
The student generally observes and depicts patterns of plant health based on access to water and light in their drawings.
CANNOT: The student might inconsistently show a plant without light as unhealthy, possibly drawing it with slightly wilted leaves but not fully conveying the lack of growth. (The student may overlook details showing inhibited growth due to lack of light.)
The student may occasionally omit labels or notes in one of the illustrations, especially when depicting multiple plants' scenarios. (Natural variation in detail focus.)
